title: Understanding the Interactions Between Human Health, Environment, and Climate in Salish Sea Communities
summary: The overarching project goal was to develop overlapping conceptual models of environmental and community health indicators in reference to climate forecasts. The sensitivity of species and habitats to climate was cross-walked with recently developed Coast Salish community health indicators (e.g., ceremonial use, knowledge exchange, and physiological well-being) in order to demonstrate how Indigenous Knowledge can be used in conjunction with established landscape-level conservation indicators (e.g., shellfish and water-quality) and employed to identify resource management priorities. Project products include: (1) maps and models that highlight potential impacts in regard to Swinomish first foods and cultural sites; (2) an evaluation [...]

organization.displayText: Pacific Coastal and Marine Science Center

history:
Tom Miewald of the NP LCC is handling this project.

11/19 - Some back and forth with NW CSC/LCC staff.  Decided under the circumstances that we did not have any data from this project.
